sentences.english: NO15, It was a long, drawn-out meeting.
I could have given others, which would, however, have neeeded a far more lengthy report.
sentences.chinese: 我可以給另外的例子，然而報告將會變得更冗長。

sentences.english: Write a quick outline of the text.
sentences.chinese: 寫一篇冗長的課文綱目。

sentences.english: The long time is a darkness moist sultry cavern likely.
sentences.chinese: 冗長的光陰像是一條陰晦溼潤的悶熱洞穴。

sentences.english: It’s easy to get caught up in the mile-long to-do list of preparations.
sentences.chinese: 你很容易被冗長的籌備清單搞得焦頭爛額。

sentences.english: Succinct is the wisdom soul, long is the superficial embellishments.
sentences.chinese: 簡潔是智慧的靈魂，冗長是膚淺的藻飾。

sentences.english: Logarithms were invented to shorten the work of extended numerical computation .
sentences.chinese: 人們發明對數來縮短運算冗長的數值計算工作。

sentences.english: We are bored by the speaker's tedious talk.
sentences.chinese: 講演者那冗長乏味的講話使我們感到厭煩。

sentences.english: To reform a man is a tedious and uncertain labour; hanging the sure work of a minute.
sentences.chinese: 改造人是冗長而無把握的工作，絞刑則是舉手之勞。

sentences.english: The dictionary is blemished by those long ineffective example sentences.
sentences.chinese: 這部詞典差就差在收錄那些過於冗長不當的例句。

sentences.english: The Anfield club face the possibility that a long, drawn-out dispute could disrupt their season.
sentences.chinese: 安菲爾德的球隊面臨賽季被冗長的爭論瓦解的可能。

sentences.english: Something that is too abstract and theoretical can be a bit tedious to listen to for too long.
sentences.chinese: 太抽象和太理論化的冗長演講，都會顯得乏味無趣。

sentences.english: She decided to abbreviate her long speech.
sentences.chinese: 她決定把她冗長的演講縮短。

sentences.english: Do not preach the Lord a sermon in your long prayers.
sentences.chinese: 切莫在你冗長的禱告中向主作一番講道。
宛如冗長漸進的時光穿廊。

sentences.english: Which brings you to the files with the hex digit gobbledygook names.
sentences.chinese: 配有十六進制數字冗長名稱的文件帶給您什麼內容。

definition: wording/way of expressing something/turn of phrase/diction
many and complicated/mired in minor details
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
disordered and in a mess (idiom); all mixed up and chaotic
anew/from the beginning/(in poetry and song) repetition of a melody or rhythm
thought-provoking/worth thinking over/to provide food for thought
to sketch in light shades/to play down/to deemphasize (idiom)
